Okay, this is creeping me out. Mikkelson opens the oven.  It's empty.  She opens a cupbo It's filled with large glass jars.  She opens another  cupboard.  More jars.  Shapes float in the jars, suspende yellow fluid.  Mikkelson and Dreyer examine the shapes --

fight back the flames with their fire extinguishers, work their way into --

Talley turns ba to the burning door and douses the flames with his fire extinguisher --
Thomas!  Thomas, it's me! Thomas and Jennifer jerk open the door, but shrink from t heat.  Talley uses the last of his fire extinguisher, the pulls them into his arms --

Talley shepherds Jennifer and Thomas past the flames --
They reach the entry, and Talley uses his pry bar to brea open the door -- A wall of cops are out on the street, waiting --
(to Thomas) Are the disks still in your room?
No!  They're right here -- Thomas pulls Marlon and Al from his pocket -- Talley clutches the disks and pulls the boy close in a spontaneous hug.  They run out the door as we --
Walter is resting comfortably when Talley steps up beside bed.  Talley is a mess--smokey, dirty, greased with sweat
(quietly) Smith. Walter opens his eyes, then Talley steps away.  Jennifer Thomas are standing behind him.  They rush to their fathe
Daddy!

I also have a couple of million in cash. Call Sonny Benza.  Ask if I can keep it. This throws Howell, too.  He didn't expect anything like this; not from Talley --
What do you want?
My wife and my daughter and the money. I'll bring the disks to the mall by the freeway, you bring my family.  We'll trade.

I think you got no choice. Howell thinks about it.  It's a tough call because Talley might be setting him up, but they're playing even hands-- Talley still has the disks --

Yeah.

I hate that Mickey Mouse bastard.  I hated his father, and I hate Sonny, too. Always with the tan.
What do you want to do?
Our people out there, they good people? People in the right place?
The best.
Sonny's a fuckup.  If he pulls this off, fine--life goes on.  But if the cops end up with those disks, we cut our losses.

I'll make the call. Vic Castellano watches Beldone depart as he considers wha about to come --
The motel floats like an island of light in the middle of nowhere.  A few cars are scattered throughout the quiet  parking lot --
is hiding in weeds across from the motel, keeping an eye the road for Talley's approaching vehicle.  A radio transmission crackles quietly --

Buster is on the dark side of thge parking lot, standing outside the pool of light in the shadows -- Gravel crunches behind him; Buster turns, and -- Talley cracks him across the face with his .45 --

Talley explodes through the door with the Fat Man in fron him like a shield --
(screaming) Police! Glen Howell jerks out his pistol as he drops behind the b Duane Manelli rolls out of a chair, aiming from the floor a two-handed grip --
Don't shoot!  Don't shoot him! Talley shifts his aim back and forth between the two men. has his back to the wall and the Fat Man in front of him

Where's my family?!  Where's my family, you fuck?! All three men are sucking air like freight engines.  No one is shooting, but if one person fires, everyone will f Everybody has something the other guy wants.  That's the thing holding them back --
Take it easy.  Just take it easy.  We're here to do business.
You said they would be here, goddamnit! Where are they? Howell releases his grip on the gun, and lets it swing fr on his finger.  He's trying to cool Talley --
They're close.  Let me make a call.  You can see they're okay.
You said they would be here! Howell takes out his phone and presses a number.  Talley shifts his aim from Howell to the Fat Man to Manelli --
(into the phone) Put on the woman. Howell offers the phone, but Talley is wary--he can't let of the Fat Man and he won't put down his pistol.  Howell carefully holds the phone to Talley's ear --
(into the phone) Jane?
Jeff, we're -- Howell backs away with the phone --
You have the disks? Talley takes out a single disk.  It's the one labeled 'Marlon.'  He tosses it onto the bed --
You get the other one when I have my girls.  Not talk to them; have them.

Close. Howell considers the disk.  If Talley has the second disk his pocket, Howell could just shoot him.  But Howell can' sure --

Marion Clewes is driving; Jane and Amanda wedged into the front seat beside him, Jane next to Mario Amanda on the far side. (into his phone) Aim your gun at the woman's head.  If he doesn't give me the disk, kill her. Marion presses a gun to Jane's temple -- Talley jerks his gun toward Howell --
